repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.unittitle: Spencer Grant Photographs

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into one series.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Mr. Grant sent negatives overseas to have them wet scanned and provided .tifs and .jpgs to DCA. He also sent the original negatives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of negatives, digital scans and contact sheets for photographs of Tufts University and its students and faculty taken by freelance photographer Spencer Grant.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Spencer Grant Collection. Boston Public Library Flickr page. http://www.flickr.com/photos/boston_public_library/collections/72157627977305452/. Accessed May 15, 2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Born in Brooklyn, New York, Spencer Grant graduated in journalism from Boston University in 1966. He worked as Air Force photographer in Nebraska and then as Associated Press photographer in New York. After moving back to Boston in 1969 Spencer worked as freelance photographer for various magazines and services among them United Press International, The Boston Globe, Time magazine, of the Boston magazine. He also did a number of also commercial shoots.

Spencer became Stock Boston photo agency's first photographer in 1971. By the end of the 1970s he worked as a full time stock photographer and, in the late 1970s, he became a stock photographer full-time.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. No documentation is available regarding the intellectual property rights in this collection.

did.unittitle: Photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains digitized images from the 1970s featuring Tufts students, faculty, and landscape.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by topic.

did.unittitle: President Burton C. Hallowell and Dean Bernie Harleston notice dog in graduation diploma line

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The dog was identified as Jean Mayer's dog Dudley by Mayer's granddaughter in March 2016. Dudley was given to Mayer by the students in Harvard's Dudley House.
